quote: The way I see it, our fates appear to be intertwined. In a land brimming with Hollows, could that really be mere chance? So, what do you say? Why not help one another on this lonely journey?
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: You really are fond of chatting with me, aren't you? If I didn't know better, I'd think you had feelings for me! Oh, no, dear me. Pretend you didn't hear that! Hah hah hah!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: Anytime you see my brilliantly shining signature, do not hesitate to call upon me.
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: I'm glad to see you alive ...You have done well, indeed you have. You've a strong arm, strong faith, and most importantly, a strong heart. I am in awe, really.
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: Why not join me, as a warrior of the Sun? Righteous knights, guardians of all that is good, in the name of the Lord of Sunlight!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: Exhilarating, is it not? The power of the Sun! I am blessed to have found such a brave companion! Hah hah hah!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: ...Ahh, it's over... ...My Sun...it's setting... ...It's dark, so dark...
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: I became Undead to pursue this! But when I peer at the Sun up above, it occurs to me… What if I am seen as a laughing stock, as a blind fool without reason?  Well, I suppose they wouldn't be far off! Hah hah hah!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: We are amidst strange beings, in a strange land. The flow of time itself is convoluted; with heroes centuries old phasing in and out. The very fabric wavers, and relations shift and obscure.
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: There's no telling how much longer your world and mine will remain in contact. But, use this, to summon one another as spirits, cross the gaps between the worlds, and engage in jolly co-operation!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: I am a warrior of the sun! Spot my summon signature easily by its brilliant aura. If you miss it, you must be blind!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: Oh, hello there. I will stay behind, to gaze at the sun. The sun is a wondrous body. Like a magnificent father! If only I could be so grossly incandescent!
author: Solaire of Astora

quote: Prithee, be careful. I don't want to see m' work squandered!.
author: Blacksmith Andre of Astora

quote: Don't get yourself killed, neither of us wants to see you go Hollow.
author: Blacksmith Andre of Astora

quote: The nice thing about weapons...they never betray you. So pay them a little respect, eh?
author: Blacksmith Andre of Astora

quote: Sen's Fortress is an old proving ground built by the ancient gods. It is the only route to the great Anor Londo. Of course, most fools can't even find their way into that fortified deathtrap. But they won't stop trying! Take that bumbling Sir Onion... Hah hah hah!
author: Blacksmith Andre of Astora

quote: Hm? No, no, I'm fine, I'm fine. Well and wide awake! Do not treat me like an old withering snake.
author: Kingseeker Frampt

quote: I am the primordial serpent, Kingseeker Frampt, close friend of the Great Lord Gwyn. Chosen Undead, who has rung the Bell of Awakening. I wish to elucidate your fate. Do you seek such enlightenment?
author: Kingseeker Frampt

quote: Heavens! You have done it! You have retrieved the Lordvessel! After a thousand years! It is you, it is really you! Hraaaoogggh! ... Forgive me. I really should calm down. Now, let us take that vessel on a journey. I assume you are ready. Now, be still!
author: Kingseeker Frampt

quote: Ahh...ohh! The Lordvessel is satiated... Magnificent... You are the righteous successor to Gwyn, the new Great Lord. And I am Kingseeker no more... Your acquaintance was an honour.
author: Kingseeker Frampt

quote: I must admit, I am fond of you humans. May you enjoy your serendipity. And may the Age of Fire perpetuate.
author: Kingseeker Frampt

quote: Let me guess. Fate of the Undead, right? Well, you're not the first. But there's no salvation here. You'd have done better to rot in the Undead Asylum… But, too late now.
author: Crestfallen Warrior

quote: Oh, your face! You're practically Hollow. But who knows, going Hollow could solve quite a bit! Hah hah hah hah…
author: Crestfallen Warrior

quote: Hm, what? Restoring your humanity? Well, there are a few ways to go about it… Collect it bit by bit from corpses, or you can butter up a cleric, and get yourself summoned.
author: Crestfallen Warrior

quote: And the quickest way, although I'd never do it, is to kill a healthy Undead, and pillage its humanity. Coveting thy neighbour is only human, after all! Hah hah hah hah…
author: Crestfallen Warrior

quote: Hm? What, you want to hear more? Oh, that's all we need. Another inquisitive soul. Well, listen carefully, then…
author: Crestfallen Warrior

quote: Oh, actually… Something strange did happen. That crow flew off with somebody in its clutches. I think it was a man curled up in a ball. Stranger things have happened, right? No, maybe not…
author: Crestfallen Warrior

quote: Don't you ever repair your weapons? You just need the right tools… or some powder. If you keep swinging those scraps around, you'll be mistaken for a hollow! Ha ha ha ha!
author: Crestfallen Warrior

quote: What's wrong? Get a bit of scare out there? No problem. Have a seat and get comfortable. We'll both be Hollow before you know it. Hah hah hah hah…
author: Crestfallen Warrior

quote: Did you ring the second bell? That is incredible, I must say… But now we have a new problem. It's noisy, it snores, and its breath is lethal…
author: Crestfallen Warrior

quote: Lousy rat! You have some nerve! I may be crestfallen, but I'm not defenseless, you rascal! You will soon regret this!
author: Crestfallen Warrior

quote: Heheh, not too shabby… I think you've done me a favour…
author: Crestfallen Warrior

quote: Perhaps I could try some rolling... Bah, no chance. My head would spin. Mmm...
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: Hrgrraaaaggh! Hiyaaaaaah! C'mon! Over here, you fiends! Perish, foul creatures! I am Siegmeyer of Catarina, and you shall feel my wrath!
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: Mmm... Hrmmmmm...
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: Still closed... Still closed... Mmm...
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: I am Siegmeyer of Catarina. Quite honestly, I have run flat up against a wall. Or, a gate, I should say.
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: So, here I sit, in quite a pickle. Weighing my options, so to speak! Hah hah hah hah!
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: And, voila! The path is open. Just goes to show. Good things come to those who wait! Hah hah hah hah!
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: This knight of Catarina hereby commends you! Take this, as a token of my gratitude. But be warned, gallantry entails great risks.
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: Adventuring is my life; I'm prepared for the worst. Hah hah hah hah!
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: By my knighthood, I am ashamed to ask... But can you spare a few scraps of moss?
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: Well, our fates do seem entwined, don't they? Perhaps this, too, is the will of Lord Gwyn! Hah hah hah hah!
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: Mm! Oh-hoh! Excuse me. I was so absorbed in thought, I just drifted away.
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: Those monsters making life difficult for you? You need not be ashamed. We are in the same boat.
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: I feel like I'm always thanking you... I curse my own inability.
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: Did you defeat those dire creatures? Outstanding... You never fail to impress. Well, wonderful.
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: Friend, I have an idea. A good one, really. ...I will rush those dire fiends, and you can slip away in the confusion.
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: Well, you've saved me, once again... Thank goodness... I'm exhausted... I think I'll have a rest. Don't you worry, the ground below me is my pillow. I'll recover shortly...
author: Siegmeyer of Catarina

quote: Well indeed, thou art a strange one! Nevertheless, I feel some liking for thee. I'm Alvina of the Darkroot Wood. I command a clan of hunters who track down defilers of the forest graves. What dost thou say? Wilt thou not join us?
author: Alvina of the Darkroot Wood

quote: Is it not so that thou art new? Thou fared well to find me.
author: Alvina of the Darkroot Wood

quote: Traversing the dark? 'Tis but a fairy tale. Have thine own respect, go not yonder knocking for nothing, I say!
author: Alvina of the Darkroot Wood

quote: You, you. Give me, warm. Give me, soft.
author: Snuggly the Crow

quote: No, (*cawing*) no. That, no. (*cawing*) That no warm. That no soft. (*cawing*)
author: Snuggly the Crow

quote: Good day! You look reasonably sane! What are you doing in the Catacombs? Are you a cleric or something?
author: Trusty Patches

quote: This place is treacherous. Do watch your step, eh? Heh heh heh...
author: Trusty Patches

quote: There's a stash of treasure right down that hole. I found it first, but... well, you're the cleric, right? I owe you for all that, er, praying and what not... I'll give you first pick. Well, go on, have a look. It'll shimmer you blind. Heh heh heh...
author: Trusty Patches

quote: Hey, don't look at me like that. I'm Trusty Patches, the one-and-only! Here, everything's good with us, eh?
author: Trusty Patches

quote: Righty-oh! Then everything's good, isn't it? I'm Trusty Patches, the one-and-only! You and I, just a couple of Undead Outcasts, right mate? Heh heh heh...
author: Trusty Patches

quote: Heh heh, this is what I do, my friend. The trinkets I'll be stripping off your corpse; that's the real treasure! Nyah hah hah hah!
author: Trusty Patches

quote: Heh heh, you got what you deserve! You damn clerics, you're worse than maggots! You must be loaded! I'll strip your corpse clean! Nyah hah hah hah!
author: Trusty Patches

quote: Blimey, how did you... You weren't supposed to survive that... Well, no matter. I'll settle this once and for all. You lousy self-righteous cleric!
author: Trusty Patches

quote: I did you wrong. But, I didn't mean it. These...temptations, they can, well, overcome me... You know what I mean? Don't you? Please forgive me. You and me, we're jolly Undead outcasts, aren't we?
author: Trusty Patches

quote: A second chance! Wonderful! I had a feeling you'd understand, I did! But if I were in your shoes... Ooh! Who know what I'd have done? But now... We're friends again, eh? Heh heh heh...
author: Trusty Patches

quote: Oh for heaven's sake, let's not mope about, eh? You're still alive, I've said I'm sorry!
author: Trusty Patches

quote: I'm done with the looting. I'm a humble merchant now! And wondrous treasure, have I! At a special price for you.
author: Trusty Patches

quote: Here, have you met that sunbathing Solaire? Believe me on this one, bruv†...He's a complete idiot.
author: Trusty Patches

quote: Welcome to Trust Patches' Trove of Treasures. We chop prices, not limbs!
author: Trusty Patches

quote: Have you heard of Trusty Patches? If ever a man has rubbed me up the wrong way, ugh! If he ever comes around again, I swear, I'll have his hide.
author: Knight Lautrec of Carim

quote: Oh, hello. I'm considering a change of location... I have a rather, pressing matter to attend to up above. That Keeper has served me well, but... Enough with her... Keh heh heh heh...
author: Knight Lautrec of Carim

quote: Well, look at you. I thought you were wiser, but I thought wrong! Tis a terrible pity. Like a moth flittering towards a flame. You fellows? No? Don't you agree?
author: Knight Lautrec of Carim

quote: By the lords... Your face... Hmmm... Your humanity is really slipping. But there are methods. Most fools have more Humanity than they know what to do with. Now, who do you imagine will make the best use of it, hmm?
author: Knight Lautrec of Carim

quote: Oh? Still human, are you? Then I am in luck. Could you help me? As you can see I am stuck, without recourse.
author: Knight Lautrec of Carim

quote: Well, this is a surprise. I get few visitors, except for ghosts.
author: Ingward

quote: The Darkwraiths are the enemies of man, and any living thing that has a soul.
author: Ingward

quote: Mm, you seem quite lucid! A rare thing in these times.
author: Big Hat Logan

quote: This place is melting my mind. The inactivity is repressive.
author: Big Hat Logan

quote: Oh, do not fret. Life isn't all about sorcery. You will find your own way. Don't frown with regret; peer forward with your head held high.
author: Big Hat Logan

quote: You have great potential. Don't go and die over nothing.
author: Big Hat Logan

quote: So, only by destroying the Primordial Crystal can you so much as scratch his hide.
author: Big Hat Logan

quote: Some would say Seath had an unsound fixation... But his work is a beautiful, invaluable resource. All progress demands sacrifice. And I certainly bear no antipathy for that wonderful scaleless beast.
author: Big Hat Logan

quote: I fail to see your design, but if you think I'm too old to defend myself, perhaps some sorcery will change you mind!
author: Big Hat Logan

quote: Heavens... the folly of youth...I'm too old for this...
author: Big Hat Logan

quote: Hrm? Well, this is unusual. You haven't lost your head. And more importantly you're free. How on Earth... ...Well, I shouldn't pry. I am Rickert of Vinheim. I was once an established smith, but look at me now. Can you believe it?
author: Rickert of Vinheim

quote: Oh, no, don't worry. I've no intention of escape. It's safe here. I can't bear the thought of going Hollow out there.
author: Rickert of Vinheim

quote: We're both cursed; Undead. But what's there, really, to moan about?
author: Rickert of Vinheim

quote: Old Big Hat? Of course I've heard of him. Who hasn't in Vinheim? He was a royal member of Dragon School, until he turned Undead. I hear he was quite the character...
author: Rickert of Vinheim

quote: Sorcery? Don't ask me how it actually works. We only fiddle and forge, until it works itself in. That's how we do it in Vinheim, at least. We prefer to leave the theorizing to those uppity scholars.
author: Rickert of Vinheim

quote: Come back soon. Smithing helps soothe my nerves. Don't let me wither away out of idleness!
author: Rickert of Vinheim

quote: Good-bye, then. Keep your head on, out there. You really help break the monotony.
author: Rickert of Vinheim

quote: You are wonderful! I will forge a Rickert masterpiece, just for you! A weapon to make a legend out of you...
author: Rickert of Vinheim

quote: Be gone with you! ...You'll spoil my focus.
author: Blacksmith Vamos

quote: ...What's that, then? Need some smithing? Then produce me some wares!
author: Blacksmith Vamos

quote: Well, what was that about? Don't be coming around here without a good reason!
author: Blacksmith Vamos

quote: Bah! You rotten scoundrel!
author: Blacksmith Vamos

quote: ...You've got rotten manners. If it be smithing you need, then produce your wares.
author: Blacksmith Vamos

quote: Yes, yes, very well! We'll get these old bones to work! Keh heh heh!
author: Blacksmith Vamos

quote: Old Vamos would never let you down, no, not ever!
author: Blacksmith Vamos

quote: ...Hmph! I'm here to smith, not to chit chat. ...I've told you, I'm here for the trade, not for the talk! ...Enough with your presence. It disturbs me.
author: Blacksmith Vamos

quote: Trying to cause trouble, are you? I am Vamos the blacksmith, and I'm no bag of bones!
author: Blacksmith Vamos

quote: Nothing at all? Fine then, rush in like a naked babe, and be skinned alive.
author: Crestfallen Merchant

quote: Hm, ah, oh you? Still alive? That's a surprise. Anything you want? What's mine is yours, but at a price!
author: Crestfallen Merchant

quote: Where do I get all my things? Stripped off the corpses of fools like yourself. It isn't easy. I have to catch them just before they go Hollow. Don't worry. I'll be there to claim your trinkets. Gazing at your final twisted grimace. Gee hee hee hee hee!
author: Crestfallen Merchant

quote: Let me give a nibble of advice. Don't even consider visiting Anor Londo. Not in your state.
author: Crestfallen Merchant

quote: There's nothing more to say. I'm finished. We're both on the brink, you see? End of story. You bloody fool.
author: Crestfallen Merchant

quote: Ahh another Undead, eh? I took on Sen's Fortress alone... But I'm no different from those vile creatures... I was driven by conceit... Ahh, you think you're different? That you can handle it? Yes, I remember that feeling.
author: Crestfallen Merchant

quote: Who art thou? One of us, thou art not.
author: Priscilla, the Crossbreed

quote: Thou must returneth whence thou came.
author: Priscilla, the Crossbreed

quote: Why dost thee hurry toward thine death?
author: Priscilla, the Crossbreed

quote: If thou hast misstepped into this world, plunge down from the plank, and hurry home. If thou seekest I, thine desires shall be requited not.
author: Priscilla, the Crossbreed

quote: This land is peaceful, its inhabitants kind, but thou dost not belong. I beg of thee, plunge down from the plank, and hurry home.
author: Priscilla, the Crossbreed

quote: Aye, siwmae. And good day to you. I'm Domhnall of Zena. I'm just, well, a peddler, of sorts. I adore trinkets and oddities, so I trade for them.
author: Domhnall of Zena

quote: Aye, siwmae. Never thought I'd see you here. This feels karmaic. Pray tell, what do you have for me?
author: Domhnall of Zena

quote: Aye, siwmae. I didn't expect to meet anybody here. I suppose great minds think alike, eh?
author: Domhnall of Zena

quote: To face them, you will require special arms... Or a cursed body.
author: Domhnall of Zena

quote: Try the bug-eyed lizards in the sewer. Desperate measures, to be sure...
author: Domhnall of Zena

quote: By the Lords...why... My precious collection...
author: Domhnall of Zena

quote: Ouch! Oww! What problem do you have now? I'm a man of peace, idiot!
author: Domhnall of Zena

quote: The bonfires attended by the Keepers are special. They are linked to one another, and their flames never die. Yet never shall the Keepers of these flames meet...
author: Darkmoon Knightess

quote: If you require rest, now is the time. That is, after all, what the bonfire is for.
author: Darkmoon Knightess

quote: Go ahead, you may rest here. Even an Undead requires repose.
author: Darkmoon Knightess

quote: Well, you are a rare visitor. Welcome to the lost city of Anor Londo, chosen Undead.
author: Darkmoon Knightess

quote: Hm, what is it? What am I? Well...I am the Keeper of the bonfire. If not for me, what beacon would there be in this lost city? A gatekeeper, and a guide; that is my calling.
author: Darkmoon Knightess

quote: Somebody! Please, let me out of here! Somebody, anybody! Help me! Unlock the door! ...Damn... ...I'm finished... How did this ever happen...
author: Griggs of Vinheim

quote: Oh, hello. Terrific to see us both in one piece. And pray that you never go Hollow!
author: Griggs of Vinheim

quote: Kindling is the art of feeding bonfires. The poor young girl, sent down into a tomb. What a terrible mission she is burdened with.
author: Griggs of Vinheim

quote: You see, Master Logan has left most of his books. With them I could teach you Logan's sorcery.
author: Griggs of Vinheim

quote: Greetings, Undead warrior. I am the primordial serpent Darkstalker Kaathe. I can guide thee, and illuminate the truth. Undead Warrior, conqueror of the Four Kings; is this not your wish? To know the truth of men, and the Undead?
author: Darkstalker Kaathe

quote: Fool... You could not be the Dark Lord. Enough of this...and farewell to you. I shall return to the Abyss, and await the true Lord of Men.
author: Darkstalker Kaathe

quote: If you wish, I shall grant the art of Lifedrain, the legendary power of the Dark Lord. It can preserve your humanity while Undead, and cast off the shackles placed upon your brethren.
author: Darkstalker Kaathe

quote: You are astonishing. The truth I shall share, without sentiment. After the advent of Fire, the ancient Lords found the three souls. But your progenitor found a fourth, unique soul. The Dark Soul. Your ancestor claimed the Dark Soul, and waited for Fire to subside. And soon, the flames did fade, and only Dark remained. Thus began the age of men, the Age of Dark.
author: Darkstalker Kaathe

quote: So, it is thou who rescueth me? Most gracious, I am deeply obliged. I am Dusk of Oolacile. I cometh from an age long before thine...
author: Dusk of Oolacile

quote: For a very long time, I was trapped within the Crystal Golem. From my home I was taken, and banish'd to a plane of distortion. It was there, that thou came to my rescue. Long after I had relinquished all hope. So gleeful was I, my faith reneweth.
author: Dusk of Oolacile

quote: Excuse me for such whimsical utterances. Only, it was so very odd...You, and Artorias. I owe my life to each of you. And each seem to share some resonance of sorts...Perhaps it is the nature of true greatness.
author: Dusk of Oolacile

quote: I still think on that creature from the Abyss that preyed on me. My faculties were far from lucid, but I quite clearly sensed certain emotions. A wrenching nostalgia, a lost joy, an object of obsession, and a sincere hope to reclaim it...
author: Dusk of Oolacile

quote: Could these thoughts belong to the beast from the Abyss? But if that were true, then perhaps it is no beast after all? Oh, please forgive my ramblings.
author: Dusk of Oolacile

quote: ...This may strike thine ear as somewhat peculiar, but...Long ago, in my homeland of Oolacile, I was beset by a creature from the Abyss. I would have perished then, were it not for the great knight Artorias.
author: Dusk of Oolacile

quote: There was something about Artorias... A certain balance of the humours...That quite perfectly fits your semblance. Heavens, could it be that... ... Oh, dear me. That was Oolacile, many centuries ago. Please excuse my fanciful musings.
author: Dusk of Oolacile

quote: ...Oh dear...What have we here? Are you a new servant?
author: Eingyi

quote: ...Hmph. But you have no eggs? Bah, no matter. Go along and have audience with Our Fair Lady. I pray that you will mind your manners!
author: Eingyi

quote: Then you shall not pass. Away with you!
author: Eingyi

quote: The nerve of you! Be gone, be gone at once!
author: Eingyi

quote: ...There is nothing to say to you...Except...If you lay a hand on the Fair Lady, you should be prepared to face my wrath.
author: Eingyi

quote: There is no time for idle chat. Think only of Our Fair Lady, and what she may need.
author: Eingyi

quote: ...You, you speak the tongue of the Fair Lady? ... Well, do not be rash with your pride. You have yet to earn my trust. If you try anything funny with the Fair Lady, there will be hell to pay.
author: Eingyi

quote: Well! ...Now...you're just like me... Your dedication is fully apparent. Only well...Your head looks awful...Why not try this? I've no use for it any longer.
author: Eingyi

quote: Worse than Undead, we are diseased, and unwanted. Like the grime of the Great Swamp. But my dear, Fair Lady! She cried for me... And swallowed the great Blightpus, despite Mistress Quelaag's orders to the contrary.
author: Eingyi

quote: Have you heard of Lost Quelana? An inhuman witch, who wanders the Poison Swamp.
author: Eingyi

quote: Well, look at this one. From what far-away age has thou come? Thy scent is very human, indeed...But, not intolerable...
author: Elizabeth

quote: Hah hah...Was thine eye, glancing hither? Thou needst not hide thy wonder. I am a mushroom, after all. Hee hee hee...
author: Elizabeth

quote: Mng. Hello. Forge, I can! Strong, I am!
author: Giant Blacksmith

quote: Cometh soon.
author: Giant Blacksmith

quote: You come, I forge, we talk. You good friend. I very happy.
author: Giant Blacksmith

quote: You come, I forge. Shiny-shiny. Get shiny from Duke. Forge weapons, make shiny. More happy.
author: Giant Blacksmith

quote: Talk, 'tis no good. But forge...very good! I help anytime.
author: Giant Blacksmith

quote: Talk, 'tis no good. No-one home. Everyone gone.
author: Giant Blacksmith

quote: But you, friend. You talk, I no talk, but happy.
author: Giant Blacksmith

quote: Mng. What's that? Shiny-shiny. Give me that. I make weapons shiny.
author: Giant Blacksmith

quote: I hath shiny-shiny, I make weapons shiny!
author: Giant Blacksmith
